titles.title: Freedom of Religious Expression in the Home Act of 2008
To amend the Fair Housing Act to prevent discrimination relating to the display of religious symbols, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 9/17/2008--Introduced. Freedom of Religious Expression in the Home Act of 2008 - Amends the Fair Housing Act with respect to discrimination in the sale or rental of housing and other prohibited practices. Makes it unlawful to establish a rule or policy that prevents a person from displaying, on the basis of that person's religious belief, a religious symbol, object, or sign on the door, doorpost, entrance, or otherwise on the exterior of that person's dwelling, or that is visible from the exterior of that dwelling, unless the rule or policy is reasonable and is necessary to prevent significant damage to property, physical harm to persons, a public nuisance, or similar undue hardship.
